description: Number of labeled rooted trees with a degree constraint: (2*n)!/(2^n)*C(2*n+1,n).
comments: a(n) is the number of rooted labeled strictly binary trees ( each vertex has exactly two children or none) on 2n+1 vertices. - Geoffrey Critzer, Nov 13 2011
references: L. Takacs, Enumeration of rooted trees and forests, Math. Scientist 18 (1993), 1-10, esp. Eq. (12).
links: INRIA Algorithms Project, Encyclopedia of Combinatorial Structures 46
Index entries for sequences related to rooted trees
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Strongly Binary Tree.
mathematica: Range[0, 19]! CoefficientList[Series[(1 - (1 - 2 x^2)^(1/2))/x, {x, 0, 20}], x] (* _Geoffrey Critzer_, Nov 13 2011 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
